TOU Rate D Time of Peak kW
Time zone used for local time calculations, such as TOU and midnight kWh reads.
Front panel LCD configuration for the Centron C1SX (RFN-410cL).
The number of seconds the LCD displays an item before cycling.
The number of kWh digits displayed on the LCD panel.
Front panel LCD configuration for the Centron.
The number of seconds the LCD displays an item before cycling.
The number of kWh digits displayed on the LCD panel.
When true, disable the meter's disconnect display (only for 420-model meters supporting disconnect).
Items displayed on the front panel LCD of Centron C2SX MCT and RFN devices (420 device types).
Items displayed on the front panel LCD of Focus AL RFN devices.
The number of seconds the LCD displays an item before cycling.
The number of kWh digits displayed on the LCD panel.
DST and time sync configuration for the MCT-440.
When true, the device recognizes DST. Else, DST changes will be ignored (flag set to 0).
Adjust real time clock when the incoming time sync differs by this many seconds.
Addressing levels used for the MCT-440.
The phase loss settings for triggering an event for the MCT-440.
The time of use schedules used for the MCT-440.
Behaviors used while communicating with DNP devices.
The number of retries the DNP Application Layer will attempt before reporting an error out to the device. Default: 2.
When true, Yukon will interpret and send times as local, else UTC. Default: false.
When true, DNP timesyncs are enabled, else disabled. Default: false.
When true, allow DNP scans to omit time request, else include. Default: false.
When true, allow sending of unsolicited class 1 messages following a device restart, else disallow. Default: true.
When true, allow sending of unsolicited class 2 messages following a device restart, else disallow. Default: true.
When true, allow sending of unsolicited class 3 messages following a device restart, else disallow. Default: true.
Interval in minutes over which most recent demand is calculated.
Interval in minutes over which profile values are kept.
The day of scheduled demand freeze/reset. 0 disables demand freeze. 32 indicates last day of month.
Profile channel settings of the MCT-470.
Used to determine which type of meter will populate profile channel 1.

The channel of the attached meter. In the case of a pulse meter, this indicates which physical KYZ channel of the MCT-470's daughter board the pulse meter is attached to. In the case of an electronic meter, this indicates which profile channel of that electronic meter to retrieve.
Resolution power for last interval demand.
Used to determine which type of meter will populate profile channel 2.

The channel of the attached meter. In the case of a pulse meter, this indicates which physical KYZ channel of the MCT-470's daughter board the pulse meter is attached to. In the case of an electronic meter, this indicates which profile channel of that electronic meter to retrieve.
Resolution power for last interval demand.
Used to determine which type of meter will populate profile channel 3.

The channel of the attached meter. In the case of a pulse meter, this indicates which physical KYZ channel of the MCT-470's daughter board the pulse meter is attached to. In the case of an electronic meter, this indicates which profile channel of that electronic meter to retrieve.
Resolution power for last interval demand.
Used to determine which type of meter will populate profile channel 4.

The channel of the attached meter. In the case of a pulse meter, this indicates which physical KYZ channel of the MCT-470's daughter board the pulse meter is attached to. In the case of an electronic meter, this indicates which profile channel of that electronic meter to retrieve.
Resolution power for last interval demand.
DST and time sync configuration for the MCT-470.
When true, the device recognizes DST. Else, DST changes will be ignored (flag set to 0).
Adjust real time clock when the incoming time sync differs by this many seconds.
Settings for channel recording and reporting
This allows voltage data to be recorded at much shorter intervals than other channels.
Interval to record voltage data internally in the meter to be returned at the Reporting Interval.
Enabling Interval will report both Interval and Midnight readings; Enabling Midnight will report only Daily Midnight readings.
Interval to record data internally in the meter to be returned with Interval reporting.
Interval at which to report Interval data recorded in the meter.
Addressing information for the MCT-430 and MCT-470.
Relay timer settings for the MCT-470.
Time the relay will remain closed in 250ms increments.
Time the relay will remain closed in 250ms increments.
The table number and read intervals that the MCT-470 uses to scan any attached IED.
Duration between each read of the attached IED.
Table to use. Use caution when changing.
The time of use schedules devices will apply to any data collected. For MCT-470 devices, the TOU schedules will only apply to data collected through their KYZ inputs.
When true, the device also stores usage into its TOU rate registers based on the TOU schedule specified below.
Profile settings for the individual channels of the MCT-430.
Used to determine which type of meter will populate profile channel 1.

The channel of the attached meter. In the case of a pulse meter, this indicates which physical KYZ channel of the MCT-470's daughter board the pulse meter is attached to. In the case of an electronic meter, this indicates which profile channel of that electronic meter to retrieve.
Resolution power for last interval demand.
Used to determine which type of meter will populate profile channel 2.

The channel of the attached meter. In the case of a pulse meter, this indicates which physical KYZ channel of the MCT-470's daughter board the pulse meter is attached to. In the case of an electronic meter, this indicates which profile channel of that electronic meter to retrieve.
Resolution power for last interval demand.
Used to determine which type of meter will populate profile channel 3.

The channel of the attached meter. In the case of a pulse meter, this indicates which physical KYZ channel of the MCT-470's daughter board the pulse meter is attached to. In the case of an electronic meter, this indicates which profile channel of that electronic meter to retrieve.
Resolution power for last interval demand.
Used to determine which type of meter will populate profile channel 4.

The channel of the attached meter. In the case of a pulse meter, this indicates which physical KYZ channel of the MCT-470's daughter board the pulse meter is attached to. In the case of an electronic meter, this indicates which profile channel of that electronic meter to retrieve.
Resolution power for last interval demand.
DST and time sync configuration for the MCT-430.
When true, the device recognizes DST. Else, DST changes will be ignored (flag set to 0).
Adjust real time clock when the incoming time sync differs by this many seconds.
The table number and read intervals that the MCT-430 uses to scan any attached IED.
Seconds between each read of the attached IED. In 15 second increments.
Table to use. Use caution when changing.
Configuration parameters for the remote disconnect feature of MCT devices.
The disconnect mode the MCT device is configured to use.
Demand threshold at which a disconnect will be triggered.
The number of minutes to delay before arming the disconnect for a reconnect.
When a disconnect command is issued to a meter configured for cycling disconnects, this is the number of minutes in the cycle that service will be disconnected.
When a disconnect command is issued to a meter configured for cycling disconnects, this is the number of minutes in the cycle that service will be connected.
When set to Arm, the meter's reconnect button must be pressed to complete a reconnect to the meter. When set to Immediate, the reconnect is automatically completed.
Configuration parameters for the remote disconnect feature of RFN devices.
The disconnect mode the RFN device is configured to use.
When set to Arm, the meter's reconnect button must be pressed to complete a reconnect to the meter. When set to Immediate, the reconnect is automatically completed.
The interval over which to calculate the meter's disconnect demand.
Demand threshold (in kW) at which a disconnect will be triggered.
The number of minutes to delay before arming the reconnect button or automatically reconnecting the meter.

The maximum number of disconnect cycles. After this limit, the meter will stay disconnected and require a reconnect command before load limiting mode can be reactivated. This limit is intended to prevent abuse and limit cycling damage to home appliances. A value of 0 disables this feature.
When a disconnect command is issued to a meter configured for cycling disconnects, this is the number of minutes in the cycle that service will be disconnected. Valid range from 5 to 1440 minutes.
When a disconnect command is issued to a meter configured for cycling disconnects, this is the number of minutes in the cycle that service will be connected. Valid range from 5 to 1440 minutes.
Configuration parameters for the voltage metrology features for RFN devices.
The period of time all voltage measurements are averaged over 60 seconds is recommended.
When true, OV/UV alarming is enabled for the RFN device. Else, the OV/UV alarming is disabled.

Voltages higher than this threshold will trigger an over voltage alarm. Values will be normalized to a 240-volt or 480-volt range automatically by the device if necessary. OV threshold shall be greater than UV threshold.

Voltages lower than this threshold will trigger an under voltage alarm. Values will be normalized to a 240-volt or 480-volt range automatically by the device if necessary. UV threshold shall be less than OV threshold.
The interval at which the RFN device reports new alarms (in minutes).
Time before repeating an alarm if state didn't change (in minutes).
The number of times the RFN device will report an alarm whose state has not changed.
Configuration parameters for the temperature alarm feature for RFN devices.
When true, temperature alarming is enabled for the RFN device. Else, the temperature alarming is disabled.
Temperatures higher than this threshold (in degrees Fahrenheit) will trigger a temperature alarm.
Time before repeating an alarm if state didn't change (in minutes).
The number of times the RFN device will report an alarm whose state has not changed.
The frequency (in seconds) to send the heartbeat message
The value to send to the device for its heartbeat countdown
